PauliStringSum2COO

PauliSumCOO(terms[, weights])

Lightweight adapter for a Pauli-sum Hamiltonian.
class tyxonq.libs.quantum_library.dynamics.PauliSumCOO(terms, weights=None)[source]#

Bases: object

Lightweight adapter for a Pauli-sum Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • terms (Sequence[Sequence[int]]) – Iterable of Pauli term encodings, each length-n with entries in {0,1,2,3} denoting I,X,Y,Z.

  • weights (Optional[Sequence[float]]) – Optional coefficients w_j. If omitted, assumed 1.0 for each term.

to_dense() → np.ndarray[source]#

Construct a dense matrix H (2^n by 2^n) for small n.

to_coo()[source]#

Return a COO-like tuple compatible with simple sparse workflows.

__init__(terms, weights=None)[source]#
to_dense()[source]#
to_coo()[source]#
tyxonq.libs.quantum_library.dynamics.evolve_state(H_or_terms, psi0, t, *, steps=128, weights=None, method='euler', backend=None)[source]#

Integrate Schrödinger dynamics for small statevectors.

Solves dψ/dt = -i H(t) ψ using a simple fixed-step scheme.

Parameters:

  • H_or_terms (Any | Sequence[Sequence[int]] | Callable[[float], Any]) –

    • Dense Hamiltonian matrix H (for small n)

    • Or Pauli-term list ([[p_00,…,p_0n], …]) with optional weights

    • Or a callable H(t) returning the instantaneous dense Hamiltonian

  • psi0 (Any) – Initial statevector of shape (2^n,).

  • t (float) – Total evolution time.

  • steps (int) – Number of integration steps (fixed step). More steps -> higher accuracy.

  • weights (Sequence[float] | None) – Coefficients for Pauli terms if H_or_terms is a term list.

  • method (str) – Currently only “euler” is implemented.

Returns:

The evolved, normalized statevector ψ(t).

Return type:

np.ndarray

tyxonq.libs.quantum_library.dynamics.expectation(psi, H, *, backend=None)[source]#

Compute the dense expectation value ⟨ψ|H|ψ⟩.

For small systems where H is explicitly dense.

tyxonq.libs.quantum_library.dynamics.PauliStringSum2COO#

tyxonq.libs.quantum_library.dynamics.evolve_state_numeric(H_or_terms, psi0, t, *, steps=128, weights=None, method='euler', backend=None)#

Integrate Schrödinger dynamics for small statevectors.

Solves dψ/dt = -i H(t) ψ using a simple fixed-step scheme.

Parameters:

  • H_or_terms (Any | Sequence[Sequence[int]] | Callable[[float], Any]) –

    • Dense Hamiltonian matrix H (for small n)

    • Or Pauli-term list ([[p_00,…,p_0n], …]) with optional weights

    • Or a callable H(t) returning the instantaneous dense Hamiltonian

  • psi0 (Any) – Initial statevector of shape (2^n,).

  • t (float) – Total evolution time.

  • steps (int) – Number of integration steps (fixed step). More steps -> higher accuracy.

  • weights (Sequence[float] | None) – Coefficients for Pauli terms if H_or_terms is a term list.

  • method (str) – Currently only “euler” is implemented.

Returns:

The evolved, normalized statevector ψ(t).

Return type:

np.ndarray

tyxonq.libs.quantum_library.dynamics.expval_dense(psi, H, *, backend=None)#

Compute the dense expectation value ⟨ψ|H|ψ⟩.

For small systems where H is explicitly dense.
